intro: Echium fontanesii var. setosum, commonly known as the hairy thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its compact, upright growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, which give it its common name. The flowers bloom in summer and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
